title: Touch-A-Truck Draws Curious, Pint-Sized 'Big Equipment Enthusiasts'
content: 17-month-old Henry Siebeneck loves the idea of leftover dirt inside the bucket of a giant skid loader.     WARSAW — Warsaw Parks & Recreation Department’s annual Touch-A-Truck event in the parking lot of Warsaw’s Center Lake on Saturday, June 2, was a popular event for enthusiastic youngsters who could barely contain their excitement at climbing up on giant construction or emergency services vehicles.    The event was held from noon until 3 p.m.    Some of the vehicles present included a police SUV, an a mbulance, skid loader, backhoe, mixer truck and vacuum truck. A cement mixer from a local concrete company, as well as a large skid loader from a Warsaw-based excavating company were popular with the “under three” crowd.    Snacks from a local car dealership, as well as a local Mexican restaurant helped provide the truck  aficionados   plenty of fuel to keep on climbing.    Field Burgan, almost 2, inspects the cab of a cement truck. He is the son of Dustin and Katy Burgan of Warsaw.     Henry Siebeneck, 17 months, talks heavy equipment with his dad, Tony Siebeneck of Warsaw.         Comments   Comments
